actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department; Health and Human Services Department; Labor Department.

official_title: A bill to suspend through July 1, 1983 the requirement that insured unemployment in a State must exceed 120 percent of the average of such unemployment in comparable periods in the 2 previous years in order to trigger "on" an extended benefit program.

summary.text: Suspends through July 1, 1983, the requirement under the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 that insured unemployment in a State must exceed 120 percent of the average of such unemployment in comparable periods in the two previous years in order to trigger "on" an extended benefit period.

titles.title: A bill to suspend through July 1, 1983 the requirement that insured unemployment in a State must exceed 120 percent of the average of such unemployment in comparable periods in the 2 previous years in order to trigger "on" an extended benefit program.
